file_content.text: No one seems to be discussing why anyone would sabotage the power grid in the first place.
No one seems to be discussing why anyone would attack the Spire and kill all those people.
Because who wants to acknowledge the truth?
What truth is that?
Some folks live for destruction. They delight in causing others to suffer.
That's awful!
It is.
Wonder how things'd be different if Arcann's twin took the throne.
Thexan? Haven't thought of him in a long time, may he stay at rest.
Saw him at a ceremony once, in my life before. Stood calm and unwavering. Strong. Wouldn't have put the Heralds in charge of the Old World.
Like having lunatics watch over a madhouse.
I don't get why the Heralds want to see everything come to an end.
You don't think folks should do things just because the "dark serpent Zildrog, the destroyer" says so? You ain't exactly alone in that.
See, that's it, though. I was taught Zildrog was a teacher. He offered tests and guidance to make people stronger.
Truth is, Zildrog lives out in the Endless Swamp. It's a monster that rises up and eats whoever's around!
Really?
Nah, it's all nonsense. All of it. Going to buy a hat or not?
You saw the Lady of Sorrows. Yeah, 'course you did. What did she look like?
She had a crown, like. And--and a suit of armor. And she was fast and strong! She could punch and kick and--
You watch too many holovids. You ever do see the Lady, my advice? Forget you ever did--and run.
Tell me, acolyte: What does the return of our great Zildrog mean to you?
It means death to disbelievers. It means the end of our corrupt society. It means great happiness for all.
You understand much. But do you know what will become of you? Your family?
We give ourselves to Zildrog's glory so that the wicked may be punished. We die so that Zakuul may live on.
Good. You are on your way. In Zildrog's name.
In Zildrog's name.
